[http://www.mamrot.gouv.qc.ca/repertoire-des-municipalites/fiche/municipalite/22010/ Répertoire des municipalités: Fossambault-sur-le-Lac] |government_type = |leader_title = Mayor |leader_name = Jean Laliberté |leader_title1 = [[List of Canadian federal electoral districts|Federal riding]] |leader_name1 = [[Portneuf—Jacques-Cartier]] |leader_title2 = [[List of Quebec provincial electoral districts|Prov. riding]] |leader_name2 = [[La Peltrie (provincial electoral district)|La Peltrie]] |leader_title3 = |leader_name3 = |leader_title4 = |leader_name4 = |area_footnotes = Statistics Canada 2011 Census - [http://www12.statcan.gc.ca/census-recensement/2011/dp-pd/prof/details/page.cfm?Lang=E&Geo1=CSD&Code1=2422010&Geo2=PR&Code2=24&Data=Count&SearchText=Fossambault-sur-le-Lac&SearchType=Begins&SearchPR=01&B1=All&Custom= Fossambault-sur-le-Lac census profile] |area_magnitude = |area_total_km2 = 13.80 |area_land_km2 = 11.38 |area_water_km2 = |area_water_percent = |area_blank1_title = |area_blank1_km2 = |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = 367 |population_footnotes = |population_total = 1613 |population_as_of = [[Canada 2011 Census|2011]] |population_density_km2 = 141.7 |population_blank1_title = Pop 2006-2011 |population_blank1 = {{increase}} 5.3% |population_density_blank1_km2 = |population_blank2_title= Dwellings |population_blank2 = 1257 |population_note = |timezone = [[Eastern Time Zone|EST]] |utc_offset = −5 |timezone_DST = [[Eastern Time Zone|EDT]] |utc_offset_DST = −4 |postal_code_type = [[Canadian postal code|Postal code(s)]] |postal_code = [[List of G postal codes of Canada|G3N]] |area_code = [[Area codes 418 and 581|418 and 581]] |blank_name = Highways |blank_info = No major routes |blank1_name = |blank1_info = |website = {{URL|www.fossambault-sur-le-lac.com|www.fossambault-
sur-le-lac.com}} |footnotes = }} '''Fossambault-sur-le-Lac''' is a French-speaking [[city (Quebec)|city]] in the south part of [[Quebec]], [[Canada]], in [[La Jacques-Cartier Regional County Municipality]], just north of [[Quebec City]]. It had a population of 1,613 as of the [[Canada 2011 Census]]. It is located near [[Lake Saint-Joseph]]. ==Demographics== ===Population=== {{Historical populations|width=60% | title= Historical Census Data - Fossambault-sur-le-Lac, QuebecStatistics Canada: [[Canada 1996 Census|1996]], [[Canada 2001 Census|2001]], [[Canada 2006 Census|2006]], [[Canada 2011 Census|2011]] census | percentages = | shading = off | align = none | cols = 3 | 1991 |817 | 1996 |921 | 2001 |1055 | 2006 |1532 | 2011 |1613 }} Private dwellings occupied by usual residents: 728 (total dwellings: 1,257) ===Language=== Mother tongue: * English as first language: 2.0% * French as first language: 96.7% * English and French as first language: 0.7% * Other as first language: 0.7% ==Places of interest== ''[[Station Touristique Duchesnay]]'' is one of the most attractive places of the town. The [[Jacques-Cartier River]] flows just nearby, and [[Route Fossambault]] links the town to [[Sainte-Catherine-de-la-Jacques-Cartier]], where the [[Sainte Catherine's church]] is located. There is also a well-known hotel, called "Hotel de la Glace", with views overlooking the lake. ==See also== *[[List of cities in Quebec]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{toponymie |23278}} }}
